1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		ModuleCmd_Help.c				     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	Provides some general help by listing the different  **
14   |  **			commands. It will also allow for a modulefile to     **
15   |  **			provide some module-specific help by calling a Tcl   **
16   |  **			procedure.					     **
17   |  ** 									     **
18   |  **   Exports:		ModuleCmd_Help					     **
19   |  ** 									     **
20   |  **   Notes:								     **
21   |  ** 									     **
22   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
23   |  ****/
24   | 
25   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
26   |  ** 									     **
27   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
28   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
29   |  ** 									     ** 
30   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
31   | 
32   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: ModuleCmd_Help.c.src.html,v 1.8 2009/09/01 20:22:32 rkowen Exp $";
33   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
34   | 
35   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
36   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | 
39   | #include "modules_def.h"
40   | 
41   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
42   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
43   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
44   | 
45   | /** not applicable **/
46   | 
47   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
48   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
49   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
50   | 
51   | /** not applicable **/
52   | 
53   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
54   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
55   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
56   | 
57   | /** not applicable **/
58   | 
59   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
60   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
61   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
62   | 
63   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
64   | 
65   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
66   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
67   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
68   | 
69   | static	int	PerModuleHelp(	Tcl_Interp*, int, char*[]);
70   | 
71   | /*++++
72   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
73   |  ** 									     **
74   |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_Help					     **
75   |  ** 									     **
76   |  **   Description:	Execution of the module-command 'help'		     **
77   |  **			Called w/o parameters it will print a list of avail- **
78   |  **			able commands. If it is called with a parameter it   **
79   |  **			will print module specific help.		     **
80   |  ** 									     **
81   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
82   |  ** 									     **
83   |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
84   |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
85   |  **			char 		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
86   |  ** 									     **
87   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
88   |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
89   |  ** 									     **
90   |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
91   |  ** 									     **
92   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
93   |  ++++*/
94   | 
95   | int  ModuleCmd_Help(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
96   | 		    	int         	 argc,
97   | 		    	char		*argv[])
98   | {
99   |     /**
100  |      **  General or module specific help wanted. General help is done within
101  |      **  here. In case of module specific help we'll call a subroutine to do
102  |      **  it ...
103  |      **/
104  |     if( argc > 0)
105  | 	PerModuleHelp( interp, argc, argv);
106  |     else
107  | 	module_usage(stderr);
108  | 
109  |     /**
110  |      **  Return on success
111  |      **/
112  | 
113  |     return( TCL_OK);
114  | 
115  | } /** End of 'ModuleCmd_Help' **/
116  | 
117  | /*++++
118  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
119  |  ** 									     **
120  |  **   Function:		PerModuleHelp					     **
121  |  ** 									     **
122  |  **   Description:	Print module specific help			     **
123  |  ** 									     **
124  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
125  |  ** 									     **
126  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
127  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
128  |  **			char 		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
129  |  ** 									     **
130  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
131  |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
132  |  ** 									     **
133  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
134  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
135  |  **					control everything		     **
136  |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
137  |  **						by the current command	     **
138  |  ** 									     **
139  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
140  |  ++++*/
141  | 
142  | static	int	PerModuleHelp(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
143  | 		    		int         	 argc,
144  | 		    		char		*argv[])
145  | {
146  |     Tcl_Interp	*help_interp;
147  |     Tcl_DString	 cmdbuf;
148  |     int		 i,
149  |     		 result;
150  |     char	 modulefile[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
151  |     char	 modulename[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
152  |     
153  |     /**
154  |      **  Initialize the command buffer
155  |      **/
156  |     Tcl_DStringInit( &cmdbuf);
157  |     g_flags |= M_HELP;
158  | 
159  |     /**
160  |      **  Handle each passed module file. Create a Tcl interpreter for each 
161  |      **  module file to be handled
162  |      **/
163  |     for(i=0; i<argc; i++) {
164  | 
165  | 	help_interp = Tcl_CreateInterp();
166  | 	if( TCL_OK != (result = Module_Init( help_interp))) {
167  | 	    Tcl_DeleteInterp( help_interp);
168  | 	    result = TCL_ERROR;
169  | 	    break;
170  | 	}
171  | 
172  | 	/**
173  | 	 **  locate the filename related to the passed module
174  | 	 **/
175  | 
176  | 	if( Locate_ModuleFile( help_interp, argv[i], modulename, modulefile)) {
177  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_LOCATE, LOC, argv[i], NULL))
178  | 		continue;
179  | 	}
180  | 
181  | 	/**
182  | 	 **  Now print the module specific help ...
183  | 	 **/
184  | 
185  |         g_current_module = modulename;
186  | 	fprintf( stderr,
187  | 		 "\n----------- %s '%s' %.*s-------\n\n", 
188  | 		 _("Module Specific Help for"),
189  | 		 g_current_module, (int)(20-strlen( g_current_module)),
190  | 		 "--------------------");
191  | 	result = CallModuleProcedure( help_interp, &cmdbuf, modulefile,
192  | 	    "ModulesHelp", 1);
193  | 
194  | 	/**
195  | 	 **  If there hasn't been any help ...
196  | 	 **/
197  | 
198  | 	if( result == TCL_ERROR)
199  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "\t*** %s %s ***\n", 
200  | 		_("No Module Specific Help for"), 
201  | 		g_current_module);
202  | 
203  | 	/**
204  | 	 **  Finally clear up the Tcl interpreter and handle the next module
205  | 	 **/
206  | 
207  | 	Tcl_DeleteInterp( help_interp);
208  |     }
209  | 
210  |     /**
211  |      **  Free the used command buffer and return on success
212  |      **/
213  | 
214  |     g_flags &= ~M_HELP;
215  |     Tcl_DStringFree(&cmdbuf);
216  | 
217  |     return( TCL_OK);
218  | 
219  | } /** End of 'PerModuleHelp' **/
